questionList.qu: In the form `y=a(b(x-c))+d`, what does a control?
questionList.solution: a is multiplied by the rest of the function, therefore affecting the stretch vertically. Confused? Check out our page on transformations for interactive examples.

questionList.qu: In the form `y=a(b(x-c))+d`, what does b control?
questionList.solution: b is multiplied by the rest of the function, therefore affecting the stretch horizontally. Confused? Check out our page on transformations for interactive examples.

questionList.qu: In the form `y=a(b(x-c))+d`, what does c control?
questionList.solution: c is subtracted from the x value directly, which directly affects the x value of the point, translating it horizontally. Confused? Check out our page on transformations for interactive examples.

questionList.qu: In the form `y=a(b(x-c))+d`, what does d control?
questionList.solution: d is added onto the rest of the function, directly correlating with the change in the y value, translating it vertically. Confused? Check out our page on transformations for interactive examples.
